column4: hi guys, i need some help: i've got a broken linux-headers package, but i can't fix it because i don't have enough disk space (netbook, / and /home and separate drives) but i can't remove any packages because i have a broken linux-headers
how can i force removing some packages so i can fix this broken package?
or are there any large files in my / directory that i can safely delete? temp files or log files or something?
you can free up space by deleting .deb packages from prior downloads/updates;  sudo apt-get clean apt-get autoclean
